sentences.cn: 这一切都只是传闻而已.

sentences.en: Certainly, no all - round knowledge can be acquired merely by glancing this way and that and relying on hearsay.
sentences.cn: 东张西望, 道听途说,绝然得不到什么完全的知识.

sentences.en: Do not place too much credit in hearsay.
sentences.cn: 不可过于相信道听途说.

sentences.en: Hearsay definitely can't be regarded as accurate information.
sentences.cn: 道听途说的决然不能算作很准确的消息.

sentences.en: I don't believe it; it's merely hearsay.
sentences.cn: 我不相信, 那仅是谣传罢了.

sentences.en: I don't know anything about it myself except from hearsay.
sentences.cn: 除听人传说的以外,我什么都不知道.

sentences.en: I know it by hearsay only.
I wouldn’t take any notice of it – it’s just hearsay.
sentences.cn: 我不会在意，这只不过是传闻而已。

sentences.en: Much of what was reported to them was hearsay.
sentences.cn: 向他们汇报的消息中很多都是道听途说。

sentences.en: She knew by hearsay that the Brainerds were wealthy and socially significant.
sentences.cn: 她听说白兰德家族又有钱又有地位.

sentences.en: They started to piece the story together from hearsay.
sentences.cn: 他们开始根据传闻把事情的经过一点点拼湊起来.

sentences.en: This is not a matter of hearsay or theory, but of fact.
sentences.cn: 这不是道听途说或者空话, 而是事实.

sentences.en: We can't make a decision based on hearsay and guesswork.
sentences.cn: 我们不能根据传言和猜测作决定。

trans.tran_cn: 传闻，道听途说，小道消息，谣传，风言风语
trans.tran_en: something that you have heard about from other people but do not know to be definitely true or correct
